availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Horace N. Congar (Newark, Essex County, New Jersey, attorney and United States Commissioner of Immigration )

body.p: Newark, Essex County, New Jersey, attorney and United States Commissioner of Immigration. New Jersey native. Son of David Congar. Admitted to New Jersey state bar in 1847. Delegate to the Republican National Convention in New Jersey in 1848. Editor of Newark Daily Mercury in 1850. Attorney in Newark, New Jersey in 1850. Delegate to the Republican National Convention in New Jersey in 1850. Appointed United States Consular to Hong Kong c1860. Appointed United States Commissioner of Immigration in 1865.

ab.bibl: Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, New Jersey, Essex County, Newark, p. 366. Find A Grave, "Horace Newton Congar (July 31, 1817-January 25, 1893)," Memorial #120946895, https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/120946895 (accessed January 29, 2020). “Biography,” Manuscript Group 408, Horace N. Cognar (1817-1898), Editor, Diplomat, and Politician, The New Jersey Historical Society, https://jerseyhistory.org/manuscript-group-408-horace-n-congar-1817-1893-editor-diplomat-and-politician-papers-1863-1905/#Biographical%20Note. KYR-0001-003-0133.
